intro: Phyllanthus cordifolius, commonly known as the heart-leaved phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant has simple, alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, often with five petals. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature.
